recipeDescription: Amritsari paneer bhurji recipe | dhaba style paneer bhurji | paneer bhurji masala gravy |
preparationMethod: To make amritsari paneer bhurji recipe, heat ghee in a small non-stick pan, add the besan.
Cook on a medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes until light golden brown, while stirring continuously.
Add chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander cumin seeds powder. Mix well and cook for a minute.
Switch off the flame and remove it in a flat plate and keep aside.
Heat oil in a broad non stick pan, add garlic, ginger, green chillies and saute for a few seconds.
Add onions and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add the prepared paste, fresh cream and mix well. Add 1 cup hot water and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes.
Add grated paneer, kasuri methi, salt and mix well. Add butter and let it cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes.
Serve amritsari paneer bhurji hot garnished with lemon and coriander.

recipeDescription: The salad is traditionally flavoured with sumac powder, which is a Middle Eastern spice made from the berries of the sumac bush. The powder has a tart flavour thus we have substituted it with pomegranate powder and lemon juice. It is worth hunting down if you possibly can. But the salad is equally delicious even if you can't find it.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients, pour the dressing on top and serve immediately.

recipeName: Arabic Salad ( Soups and Salads Recipe )
recipeDescription: Salads are an integral part of an arabian meal and accompany their main meals. This salad is rich in colour and uses up all the vegetables and ingredients that are easily available in the region. In this version we’ve used the beautiful cherry tomatoes, green and black olives, mint and iceberg lettuce all tossed in with a tangy dressing that uses pomegranate powder, and the special baharat powder that brings in a unique flavour. It is different and exotic!
preparationMethod: Immerse the lettuce leaves in ice - cold water for 10 minutes and drain well. This will make them crisp.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, pour the dressing on top and toss well.
Serve immediately.

recipeName: Butter Beans and Mixed Vegetable Cheese Soup
recipeDescription: A soup that has a touch of everything you love! It’s cheesy, it’s tangy, its’ crunchy, it’s creamy, it’s all that you can ask for. Yes, the Butter Beans and Mixed Vegetable Cheese Soup is a sumptuous treat that combines crunchy and juicy veggies like onions, capsicum and tomatoes with cooked butter beans. Tomato ketchup and herbs give it a memorable flavour, while a garnish of cheese gives it a gooeyness you can’t resist. Enjoy this soup hot and fresh, with slices of buttery toast .
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a deep non-stick pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the butter beans, tomato ketchup, oregano, salt, pepper powder and 3 cups of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Serve hot garnished with cheese.

recipeDescription: cabbage pakoda recipe | cabbage pakora South Indian style | Indian patta gobhi ke pakode | quick snack | with 18 amazing images. cabbage pakoda recipe | cabbage pakora South Indian style | Indian patta gobhi ke pakode | quick snack is a tasty snack to be enjoyed at a family get-together. Learn how to make cabbage pakora South Indian style. To make cabbage pakoda, combine all the ingredients along with approx. 2 tbsp of water in a deep bowl and mix well. Drop spoonfuls of the mixture into hot oil in a deep non-stick pan and deep-fry a few at a time on a medium flame, till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides. Drain on an absorbent paper. Serve immediately with green chutney and tomato ketchup. Pakodas don’t always have to be onion-based. Here is an irresistibly crunchy and excitingly flavoured cabbage pakora South Indian style made with patta gobhi. With a flavourful touch of coriander, the cabbage is held together with besan to make awesome pakodas. The Indian patta gobhi ke pakode pairs best with green chutney or tomato ketchup. You can also serve them hot and fresh for parties or as a quick snack, with a cup of steaming tea or coffee. If you like Indian patta gobhi ke pakode, then also try other pakoras like Khichdi Pakodas, Stuffed Methi Paneer Pakoda, Stuffed Spinach Pakoda to make a pakoda platter. Tips for cabbage pakoda. 1. Cabbage should be shredded thinly as shown here. 2. Remember to not add too much water while mixing the ingredients because cabbage will also slowly let out water as you have shredded it thinly. That, along with a tablespoon or two of water, is enough to bind the batter. If the batter becomes watery, the pakodas won’t be crunchy enough. 3. This mixture should be used immediately and not kept for long as it will release water and you will find it difficult to make pakodas. 4. Oil should be hot and always deep-fry on a medium flame so they cook well. Do not fry them over low flame, the cabbage pakoda will absorb too much oil and turn soggy. And if you deep-fry on a high flame then they will get burnt. Enjoy cabbage pakoda recipe | cabbage pakora South Indian style | Indian patta gobhi ke pakode | quick snack | with step by step photos.
preparationMethod: To make cabbage pakoda, combine all the ingredients along with approx. 2 tbsp of water in a deep bowl and mix well.

Drop spoonfuls of the mixture into hot oil in a deep non-stick pan and deep-fry a few at a time on a medium flame, till they turn golden brown in colour from all the sides. Drain on an absorbent paper.
Serve the cabbage pakoda immediately with green chutney and tomato ketchup.

ingredients: large sized clove of garlic (lehsun) , chopped
recipeDescription: A calzone is like a folded over stuffed pizza. The circle of pizza dough is folded in half over the filling and then sealed. During baking, the pizza dough swells somewhat until it resembles a "stuffed stocking", the literal translation of word calzone. Sautéed vegetables and cheese aromatized with herbs is the filling for this calzone. You can vary the vegetable combination if you like. For a change, try frying the calzone until golden brown in hot oil. You will find that it is easier to handle the calzone during frying when it has been formed into appetiser sized calzonetti (or smaller calzones). Calzone can stand alone as a substantial snack or combined with a green salad and soup, it makes an easy dinner.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a saucepan and sauté the onion and garlic for a minute.
Add the mushrooms and red pepper and sauté for some more time.
Sprinkle the flour and add the milk, cheese, oregano and salt and mix well. Bring it to a boil.
Divide the mixture into 4 portions. Allow it to cool. Keep aside.
Divide the pizza dough into 4 equal portions. Keep aside under a wet cloth.
Roll out each portion of the dough into a 150 mm. (6") diameter circle.
Put one portion of the filling on each circle.
Fold each circle to form a semicircle.
Seal the ends using a little water and press the edges firmly with the help of a fork.
Place on a greased baking tray. Cover with a wet cloth and keep for 10 minutes or until it doubles in volume.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for about 15 minutes or until they are evenly browned.
Remove from the oven and brush with melted butter.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: The chewy texture of mushrooms and the crispness of capsicum are a good combination, especially when they are sautéed minimally such that they retain their characteristics. Apart from using aromatic oregano, this preparation of Capsicum and Mushrooms with Oregano also stands out in its use of Tabasco sauce, which lends the dish the strong and spicy flavour of special Tabasco capsicums.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a broad non-stick pan, add the garlic and capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the mushrooms and salt and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the tabasco sauce, oregano and chilli flakes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 more minute.
Serve immediately garnished with spring onion greens.

recipeDescription: A homemade pie crust houses a creamy filling of cauliflower and broccoli in white sauce, flavoured with pepper and covered with cheese, ready to be baked into a delicacy that none can resist! The pie crust has a superb melt-in-the-mouth texture, which perfectly complements the gooey filling. Just make sure the white sauce is thick enough; otherwise it will ooze through the short crust pastry and make the Cauliflower Broccoli Pie soggy and difficult to eat. Serve the pie immediately to relish the awesomely cheesy texture! A bowl of your favourite soup and a slice of Cauliflower and Broccoli Pie will team up well for a satiating meal.
preparationMethod: Sieve the flour. Add the butter and salt and rub in with your fingertips.
Add about 1½ tbsp of ice-cold water to make a dough
Roll out the dough into a 200 mm. (8”) diameter circle.
Arrange the rolled out dough in a greased 175 mm. (7”) diameter pie dish.
Press the dough into pie dish and prick with a fork on the bottom and sides.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 15 minutes. Keep aside.
Combine the cauliflower florets, broccoli florets, white sauce, salt and pepper in a deep bowl and mix well.
Fill the mixture in the short crust pastry.
Sprinkle cheese on top and bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 15 minutes.
Cut into 4 equal wedges and serve immediately.

preparationMethod: To make cauliflower greens mixed sprouts tikki, combine all the ingredients into a deep bowl and mix very well using your hands.

Heat a non-stick tava (griddle) and grease it with 1 tsp of oil. Cook all the tikkis on it, using 1 tsp of oil, till they turn golden brown in colour from both the sides.
Serve the cauliflower greens mixed sprouts tikki immediately with coriander chutney.

recipeName: Cauliflower Greens, Methi and Palak Healthy Subzi
recipeDescription: Do you tend to use the cauliflower and throw away the greens? When the seeds crackle, add the onions and ginger-garlic paste and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the tomatoes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the chilli powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt and 2 tbsp of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the greens and ½ cup of water, mix well, cover with a lid and cook on a medium flame for 4 to 5 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Gourmet cooking can sometimes be easier than everyday cooking; what makes it ‘gourmet’ are the aesthetic, innovative touches! It can be prepared easily and quickly using common ingredients, but a thoughtful twist of flavouring the cauliflower soup with nutmeg makes it unique and exotic.
preparationMethod: Boil 4 cups of water in a deep pan, add the cauliflower and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 10 minutes or till they turn soft, while stirring occasionally. Keep aside.
Heat the butter in a deep non-stick pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 1 minute.
Add the plain flour and cook on a medium flame for a few seconds, while stirring continuously.
Add the milk, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute, while stirring continuously.
Add the cauliflower-water mixture, nutmeg powder and salt and mix well.
Blend in a mixer till smooth.
Serve immediately garnished with cheese and nutmeg powder.

recipeDescription: Cauliflower is one of the best suited stuffing for parathe. The best part is that it cooks quite fast too; you just need to know the right way to prepare it so it won’t get mushy. This particular Cauliflower Stuffing (For Parathas) is extremely flavourful, as it is well supported by green chillies, cumin seeds and coriander. Add the onions, green chillies and sauté on medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the cauliflower and salt, sprinkle a little water, mix well and cook on medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the coriander and mix well.
Serve hot.

preparationMethod: To make chapati masala noodles, place one roti over the other one by one and roll it up.

Heat the butter in a broad non-stick pan, add the onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Sprinkle a little water to avoid the onions from burning.

Add the black salt, garam masala and salt mix well and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute, while stirring occasionally.

recipeDescription: A lip-smacking preparation of paneer that is sure to excite your taste buds. Perfectly suited to the expectations of desi food lovers, Chatakedar Paneer features succulent cottage cheese cubes enhanced with not just tangy tomatoes, dried fenugreek leaves and regular spice powders like chilli and coriander seed powders, but also pav bhaji masala, which gives it an intense flavour reminiscent of the all-time favourite street food!
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a deep non-stick kadhai, add the green chilli paste and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.

Add the paneer cubes, mix well and cook on a medium flame for another 1 to 2 minutes.
Add the lemon juice and mix well.
Serve hot garnished with coriander sprig.

recipeDescription: If there is one ingredient that is as indigenous as it is international, we would say that is our favourite paneer. Try tossing fresh, soft paneer with pav bhaji masala, and this chatakedar paneer will become a favourite beyond comparison!
preparationMethod: Put the oil in a microwave-safe bowl and microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Add the green chilli paste, mix well and microwave on high for 30 seconds.

Add the tomatoes, tomato purée, chilli powder, coriander seeds powder, pav bhaji masala, dried fenugreek leaves and salt, mix well and microwave on high for 3 minutes, stirring in between after every 1 minute.
Add the paneer cubes, mix well and keep aside to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
Microwave the paneer mixture on high for 3 minutes, stirring twice in between.
Add the lemon juice and mix well.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: The herby taste of celery and the pungency of garlic team up to make a superb spread for toasted bread. preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients and blend in a mixer to a coarse paste without using water. Keep aside.
Place the bread slices on a clean, dry surface and apply little of the celery garlic spread evenly on each bread slice.
Sprinkle ½ tbsp. Of cheese evenly over each celery garlic spread bread slice.
Bake them in a pre-heated oven at 200°c(400°f) for 15 minutes or till the toasts are evenly crisp.
Cut each toast into 2 pieces diagonally and serve immediately.

preparationMethod: To make the cheese toast, combine the cheese, capsicum, tomato ketchup and butter in a deep bowl and mix well.

Grease a baking tray with butter.
Place the bread slices on the baking tray.
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 10 to 15 minutes.
Cut the baked cheese toast diagonally into 2 equal pieces.
Serve the cheese toast immediately.

recipeDescription: A very cheesy dip that tastes fab with thin and crispy Melba Toast! Ideal to serve at parties, the Cheesy Spinach Dip is made easily by combining white sauce, cheese and spinach. Perked up with pepper and chilli flakes, this wonderful dip goes down well with adults and kids alike.
preparationMethod: Heat the butter in a broad non-stick pan, add the plain flour and cook on a medium flame for a few seconds, while stirring continuously.
Add the milk, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Add the cheese, chilli flakes, spinach, salt and pepper, mix well and cook on a medium flame for another 1 minute.
Serve immediately with melba toast.

recipeDescription: Layers of saffron-tinged cashew barfi, badam barfi and pista barfi play together to create a chequered barfi that looks good and tastes wonderful. Take a bite and chew it for a minute to let the flavours sink in and stir up your taste buds.
preparationMethod: Make the badam, cashew and pista barfis as mentioned in their respective recipes.
Dissolve the saffron in the milk, add it to the cashew barfi and mix well.
Divide the badam barfi, cashew barfi and pista barfi into 3 equal portions.
Roll out each portion into a cylindrical of 200 mm. (8") length and 6 mm. (1/4") thickness.
On a sheet of plastic, place one badam roll, one cashew roll and one pista roll next to each other, to form a layer.
Top the first layer with a cashew roll, pista roll and badam roll (in that order).
Top with the third layer of pista roll, badam roll and cashew roll.
Press gently so that all the barfi rolls stick together to form a rectangle.
Garnish the rectangle with the silver leaves.
Cut the rectangle into 8 slices of 25 mm. (1") thickness.

recipeDescription: An elegant dessert ready in minutes! The chocolate and date mousse is a brilliant combination of streams of dark chocolate and dates streaked with whipped cream and dotted with chopped dates and walnuts. preparationMethod: Heat a small pan and add the dates and milk, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.

recipeDescription: how to clean and blanch mushrooms recipe | easy way to slice and cook mushrooms | blanched sliced mushrooms | how to slice mushrooms | with 10 amazing images. how to clean and blanch mushrooms recipe | easy way to slice and cook mushrooms | blanched sliced mushrooms | how to slice mushrooms is a step by step process to get perfectly blanched mushrooms. Learn how to slice mushrooms. To clean and blanch mushrooms, boil a vessel full of water along with little salt. Add the mushrooms and allow them to cook for 30 to 40 seconds. Mushrooms apart from being low in calories, are a store house of nutrients like folate, B vitamins and potassium. Though blanched sliced mushrooms are not very high in fibre, they have a low carb count and that’s what makes them suitable for weight-watchers, diabetics and heart disease. Clean and blanch mushrooms can be used to make sabzis like mushroom curry and even our favourite snack like tomato mushroom and spinach pizza. Tips to clean and blanch mushrooms. 1. You can cut them thick or thin depending on its use. 2. Always add little salt in water, as the mushrooms absorb salt easily at this stage. 3. Here we have sliced them, but you can follow the same method for chopped, cubed or quartered mushrooms. 4. To prevent over cooking, remember to add them to a bowl of water immediately upon blanching. preparationMethod: To make spinach puree, take a bunch of spinach and get cut of the the stems and discard them.
Roughly chop the leaves and wash thoroughly under running water or in a bowl full of water.

Boil vesselful of water and add salt to it.
Add the chopped and washed spinach to boiling water and mix well.
Let it cook for 2-3 mins and strain it with a strainer.

recipeName: Lilliputian Palm Trees- Capsicum and Cucumber Trees ( Vegetable Carvings)
recipeDescription: Flavourful capsicum atop crunchy cucumbers and viola. The perfect salad companions that you can munch on endlessly!
preparationMethod: Beginning from the side, opposite to the tip, make deep and wide v-shaped cuts using a knife. This means that the part where the tip is there will be smaller in size than the other part.
Using a knife lift the v-shaped capsicum edges so it becomes easier to detach.
Pull the 2 parts of the capsicum lightly apart.
Detach the two parts from each other completely. This is how they look like then.
Discard the part with the tip. Clean the other part of the capsicum to remove the seeds using a knife.
Make a small v-shaped cuts along the sides and keep aside. This forms the leaves of the palm tree. Keep aside.
Cut the edges of the cucumber from one side so that it can stand straight.
Using the edge of the knife and make a u-shape (around 2 cm. In length) and then pull it a bit apart.

Make another u-shape on top of the previous u-shape in a way that the middle thin slice in between the 2 u’s can be removed and discarded. Make many such ridges at regular intervals on the cucumber. This forms the trunk of the palm tree.
Pierce the capsicum piece on it from the centre with a pin.

To decorate it, on a long rectangular or big oval plate, arrange 2 to 3 such palm trees. Spread the dark chocolate cake crumbs around the trees to look like the sand and use grated blue jelly to get the sea effect.

recipeDescription: Spinach and cottage cheese stuffed in tubular pasta or cannelloni covered with oodles of cheese always finds its way in dinner menus! Well made cannelloni cannot be achieved without some effort, but the results are always superb. Basically there are four separate elements : the stuffing, the fresh pasta in which the stuffing is enclosed, the cheese that covers and protects the filled cannelloni as it heats and the sauce. The filling and the sauce can be prepared a day in advance, then assembled just before serving. Ready-made dry pasta sheets can be purchased to shorten the cooking process.
preparationMethod: Blanch the spinach in boiling water. Refresh in ice-cold water and drain out the water. Keep aside.
Chop finely and mix with the cottage cheese, green chillies, nutmeg powder, cream and salt. Keep aside.
Prepare the pasta dough as mentioned in the recipe.
Divide the pasta dough into 6 portions and roll out each portion as thinly as possible.
Cut each portion of the rolled out dough into a 100 mm. x 150 mm. (4" x 6") rectangle, to make 6 cannelloni sheets.
Boil plenty of water in a broad pan and add 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of oil.
Drop the prepared pasta one sheet at a time into the boiling water and cook for 2 minutes.
Drain and transfer into a bowl of cold water. Drain again and keep aside.
Heat the butter, add the flour and sauté for 1 minute.
Slowly pour in the milk, whisking it continuously so that no lumps form. Bring to a boil.
Add salt and pepper and mix well. Remove from the fire.
Fill each cannelloni sheet with 1 tablespoon of the spinach stuffing and roll up.
Arrange on a greased baking dish, pour the white sauce over the prepared cannelloni and sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 200 (400) for 15 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Looking for a snack that is easy to prepare yet healthy and non-fried? Try these delicious spinach and cottage cheese dumplings innovatively flavoured with nutmeg powder. preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.

recipeDescription: spinach and mint juice recipe | palak pudina drink | with 24 amazing images. Put the excitement back into your day with this punch-packed Spinach and Mint Juice. preparationMethod: To make spinach and mint juice, combine the spinach, mint leaves and coriander along with ½ cup of water in a juicer and blend till smooth.

Add the lemon juice and jal jeera powder and mix well.
Add some crushed ice in 4 small individual glasses and pour equal quantities of the juice over it.

recipeDescription: Soup, with a lovely taste and consistency. This soup is brimful of the goodness of spinach and spring onion greens, not to forget a dash of coriander and mint. The nutmeg and black pepper not only spike up the flavour, they also bring in their healing properties—making this a true herbal delight.
preparationMethod: Combine the spinach, mint leaves, coriander, spring onion greens and 4 cups of water in a deep non-stick pan, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain well.

Heat the butter in a deep non-stick pan, add the plain flour and cook on a slow flame for 1 minute, while stirring continuously.
Add the spinach purée, 2 cups of water, nutmeg powder, pepper powder, fresh cream and salt, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 to 3 minutes, while stirring continuously.
Serve immediately garnished with fresh cream.

recipeDescription: A sumptuous and colourful spread of vibrant spinach and crumbled paneer, which looks like snowflakes just fallen on a green field, adorns crisped bread slices, ready to energize you with its great taste, brilliant texture and bagful of nutrients! Indeed, the spinach and paneer toast is a wonderful after-school snack for kids, an apt starter at a party, or an anytime snack for the food-lover!
preparationMethod: Cut each bread slice into 2 equal halves. You will get 12 bread halves in all.
Apply a little melted butter on all the bread halves and bake them in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 5 to 7 minutes or till they turn crisp. Keep aside.
Heat the butter in a broad non-stick pan, add the green chillies and onions and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the spinach, baking soda, salt and black pepper powder, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 3 minutes, while stirring occasionally.
Add the paneer and mix well.
Divide the spread into 6 equal portions and keep aside.
Place all the bread toasts on a clean, dry surface, apply a portion of the spinach and paneer spread and sprinkle 1 tsp of cheese on each toasted bread slice.
Place them on a baking tray and bake in a pre-heated oven at 200°c (400°f) for 5 to 7 minutes or till the cheese melts.

recipeDescription: Spinach and cottage cheese make a good filling for crepes which are topped with Mexican green sauce.

recipeName: Spinach Gnocchi with Almond Butter Sauce
recipeDescription: Gnocchi are almost easier to make than to pronounce "n-yoki". The word means "lumps" because of the irregular, somewhat craggy shapes these dumplings have. Gnocchi are boiled in the same fashion as pasta is and are served generally with a cream based sauce. Spinach and cottage cheese gnocchi served in a toasted almond and butter sauce makes an outstanding first course. Alternatively, try gnocchi as a rich and creamy side dish. Make sure you drain out all the water from the spinach before you make the gnocchi. Test one gnocchi by boiling it in water. If it crumbles, add some more flour to the mixture. Always make the gnocchi the day you are going to serve them, because they will discolour if left overnight. Also prepare the sauce just before you are ready to eat!
preparationMethod: Blanch the spinach in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and refresh in ice-cold water. Drain again and squeeze out all the water.
Chop the spinach finely.
Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well to form a soft dough.
Divide the gnocchi into approximately 30 equal sized balls.
Press each one gently to flatten them using a fork.
Boil plenty of water in a broad pan and add 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 tablespoon of oil to it.
When the water is boiling, add the gnocchi a few pieces at a time and allow them to cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
Carefully remove the gnocchi from the boiling water, using a slotted spoon. Keep aside.
Heat the butter in a pan and sauté the almonds till they are lightly toasted.
Season with pepper and keep aside.
Just before serving, toss the gnocchi in the almond butter sauce and mix well.
Serve immediately.

preparationMethod: To make spinach lettuce and spring onion soup, heat the butter in a pressure cooker, add the spinach, lettuce and spring onions and sauté on a medium flame for 1 to 2 minutes.

preparationMethod: To make sprouts dhokla, combine the sprouted moong , spinach and green chillies and blend in a mixer using a little water to a smooth paste.

recipeName: Stir Fried Beans, Capsicum and Tomatoes ( Chinese Cooking )

Add the drained sprouts, lemon juice and salt and mix well.

recipeDescription: veg cheese omelette recipe | Indian style veggie cheese omelette | healthy cheesy omelette | with 15 amazing images. The Veg Cheese Omelette is an Indian style veggie cheese omelette made by pan-cooking (like pancakes) a mixture of eggs and chopped veggies, seasoned excitingly with dried herbs and green chillies. Omelette is an egg preparation which has a lot many variations and here we have got you the Indian style vegetable cheese omelette. A topping of cheese adds a gooey dimension to the veg cheese omelette, making it more filling and cheesily exciting. veg cheese omelette is made with only common ingredients and everyday veggies like tomatoes and capsicum, the flavours and textures mingle really well to create a zesty bite that you are sure to relish thoroughly. veg cheese omelette can be prepared in a jiffy and it is made using the most basic ingredients which I bet are available in every Indian household pantry, even if it is not well maintained. Eggs are rich source of protein which make our veg cheese omelette protein rich. Moreover eggs are a fairly good source of calcium, vitamin D and phosphorus. All these nutrients along with protein work towards building strong bones and preventing osteoporosis. We suggest you use a good quality cheese to keep the recipe very healthy. Some people also add milk to the egg mixture which makes the Indian style cheese omelette soft and fluffy, so if you wish to even you can add that procedure. veg cheese omelette is my go recipe for quick breakfast or evening snack as it can prepared under 10 minutes and is supremely delicious. Serve it slices of toasted bread to make it the perfect breakfast recipe, along with a hot cup of coffee or Masala Chai. You can also try other egg-based recipes like the Egg Bhurji and Egg Sandwich. Enjoy veg cheese omelette recipe | Indian style veggie cheese omelette | healthy cheesy omelette | with detailed step by step recipe photos and videos below.
preparationMethod: To make veg cheese omelette, combine the eggs, salt and pepper in a deep bowl and whisk well using a fork.
Add all the other ingredients, except the butter, cheese and mixed herbs and mix very well.
Heat the butter in a broad non-stick pan, pour the egg mixture, cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Turnover and cook on a medium flame for 2 more minutes.
Put the cheese on one side of the omelette and sprinkle the dried mixed herbs evenly over it.
Fold the omelette into a semi-circle and cook on a medium flame for 1 minute.
Serve the veg cheese omelette immediately with toasted bread slices and tomato ketchup.

recipeName: Vegetable Florentine, Baked Vegetables and Spinach
recipeDescription: vegetable florentine recipe | baked vegetables and spinach | microwave veg florentine | Indian baked spinach florentine | with 34 amazing images. vegetable florentine recipe | baked vegetables and spinach | microwave veg florentine | Indian baked spinach florentine is a one dish meal loaded with veggies and cheese. Learn how to make baked vegetables and spinach. To make vegetable florentine, for the spinach layer, place the spinach in a microwave safe plate and microwave on high for 1 minute. Cool slightly. Blend the spinach in a blender to a smooth purée and keep aside. Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 40 seconds. Add the onions, flour and green chillies, mix well and microwave on high for 3 minutes, stirring once in between after 1½ minutes. Add the spinach puree, cream, salt and pepper, mix well and microwave on high for 4 minutes, stirring once in between after 2 minutes. Keep aside. For the vegetable layer, combine the mixed vegetables with ½ cup of water in a microwave safe shallow dish and microwave on high for 15 minutes, stirring twice after every 5 minutes. Add the white sauce and mix well. Keep aside. Spread the prepared spinach layer in a shallow microwave safe dish, top with the prepared vegetable layer and cheese and microwave on high for 4 minutes. Serve immediately. The baked vegetables and spinach look as dainty as its name sounds! An assortment of vegetables in white sauce is spread on a layer of creamy spinach, and finally topped with cheese. The vibrant colours of the vegetables contrast well with the light shades of the sauce and cheese, not to forget the splashes of green contributed by the spinach in Indian baked spinach florentine. Microwave cooking retains the colours, and locks in the flavours of the ingredients, making this microwave veg florentine an epitome of perfection. This baked dish is truly a party fare! Tips for vegetable Florentine. 1. The white sauce should be thick and not too thin. 2. Ensure that you blend the spinach well to a smooth purée. 3. We have used a combination of mozzarella cheese and processed cheese, but if you wish you can use any one cheese. Enjoy vegetable florentine recipe | baked vegetables and spinach | microwave veg florentine | Indian baked spinach florentine | with step by step photos.
preparationMethod: Place the spinach in a microwave safe plate and microwave on high for 1 minute. Cool slightly.
Blend the spinach in a blender to a smooth purée and keep aside.

Put the butter in a microwave safe bowl and microwave on high for 40 seconds. Add the onions, flour and green chillies, mix well and microwave on high for 3 minutes, stirring once in between after 1½ minutes.
Add the spinach puree, cream, salt and pepper, mix well and microwave on high for 4 minutes, stirring once in between after 2 minutes. Keep aside.
Combine the mixed vegetables with ½ cup of water in a microwave safe shallow dish and microwave on high for 15 minutes, stirring twice after every 5 minutes.
Add the white sauce and mix well. Keep aside.
To make vegetable florentine, spread the prepared spinach layer in a shallow microwave safe dish, top with the prepared vegetable layer and cheese and microwave on high for 4 minutes.
Serve immediately.

recipeDescription: Need to whip up a party fare within short notice? This quick-to-prepare, tasty and rich recipe is the perfect choice. A simple and tasty Microwave version of vegetable korma, this is best eaten with hot parathas .
preparationMethod: Combine the paneer with ½ cup water and ½ teaspoon salt in a microwave-proof bowl and microwave on high for 1 minute. Keep aside.
Combine the oil, onion paste and ginger-garlic paste in another microwave-proof bowl, mix well. Cover with a lid and microwave on high for 1 minute.
Add the turmeric powder, chilli powder, coriander powder and tomato purée, mix well and microwave on high for 30 seconds.
Add the cooked vegetables, milk, 1 tablespoon of cream, paneer and salt, mix well and microwave on high for 1 minute.
Just before serving, top with the remaining cream and serve hot.

recipeDescription: A unique drink with an intermingling taste of tomato juice and worcestershire sauce with a dash of lemon and pepper.
preparationMethod: Dip the rim of the glass in lemon juice shaking off the excess. Then roll the glass in salt and allow the frosting to dry.
Shake all the ingredients in a cocktail shaker and pour into glass.

recipeDescription: This is the perfect way to cook tinda when it is in season. With onions, tomatoes and spices, cooked together in a simple but effective way, the round gourd transforms into a great accompaniment for phulkas and parathas. Although it is made with minimal spices, the low-calorie Tinda Masala tastes fabulous and has a very pleasing mouth-feel too.
preparationMethod: Heat a deep non-stick kadhai on a medium flame and when hot, add the onions and dry roast for 5 minutes.

Add the tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin seeds powder, turmeric powder, chilli powder, salt and ¼ cup of water, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 4 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Add the tinda and ½ cup of water and mix well. Cover with a lid and cook on a slow flame for 12 minutes ,while stirring occasionally.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: A spoonful of adrak chutney makes for a lovely side dish, dip or accompaniment recipe. Adrak or ginger is good for digestive and respiratory complaints and hence this chutney made from crushed adrak or ginger should feature in your menu.
preparationMethod: Combine the ginger, red chillies,tamarind, curry and coriander leaves, salt and asafoetida and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Keep aside.
For the tempering, heat the oil in a kadhai and add the mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and saute for 30 seconds.
Add the tempering to the chutney, mix well and bring it to boil.
Cool and serve.

recipeDescription: A ginger flavoured vegetable recipe,Adraki gobhi has the just right flavour of ginger embedded in the cauliflowers. A delicious vegetable recipe with a lovely ginger flavour, the adraki gobhi is best enjoyed with roti or Parathas.
preparationMethod: Heat oil, put garlic fry for 1 min, put caulifowers and cover it with lid stirring in between till they are half done.
Add salt, corrinader and red chilly powder. and cook till done.
Add lemon juice and cook for 1 minute and garnish it with corrinader.

recipeDescription: A tempting adraki mushroom recipe with ginger or adrak is a dominant flavour in it. It is a simple and quick to prepare with unique flavors.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the onions and sauté till it turns to light golden brown.
Add the ginger, green chilies, coriander powder, turmeric powder and salt and cook for one minute.
Add the tomatoes and red chili powder and cook till oil leaves the masala.
Add the mushrooms, mix well, cover and cook for another 10 minutes on a medium flame.
Open the lid and add the garam masala and cook for 5 minutes on a high flame.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: This paan is an immediate remedy for stomach aches. pregnant ladies may be given this after a heavy meal as this paan also cures in-digestion. children may be given this paan as it activates hunger. since the scented lime contains calcium,it is good for anybody eating the paan. from, jayasree krishnan
preparationMethod: Clean the beetel leaves.
Keep the ajwain on the leaves after
Brushing the leaves with scented lime.
Fold the leaves neatly in a paan.

recipeDescription: A delicious and tasty pakodes with ajwain flaovour and aroma.
preparationMethod: Combine the besan, ½ tsp red chilli powder, turmeric powder, baking soda, salt, asafoetida, 3 tbsp hot oil and sufficient water in a bowl and whisk well to make a smooth batter. The batter should not be thick.
Wash the leaves well and pat them dry.
Dip each leaf in batter and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on absorbent paper.
Sprinkle chaat masala and remaining red chilli powder.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: So try out these delicious fingers!!
preparationMethod: Grease and line an squarecake tin.
Put the butter,chocolate and honey in a pan and heat gently until melted.
Stir in the biscuits crumbs and almond until thoroughly mixed,turn into the prepared tin and smooth the top.
Leave until set,then cut into fingers before serving.

recipeDescription: A very nutritious cold drink which can be enjoyed both during summer and Winter. This is also very rich enough that you can stay fit and active with just a cup of this drink for a hurry breakfast before work.
preparationMethod: Blend the dates along with the little water in a mixer to a fine juice.
Put the almonds in hot water for 5 minutes, drain and peel the skin off.
Blend the almonds in a mixer with some water to smooth paste.
Combine the dates paste and almonds paste and and blend again till mixed well.
Strain and pour the drink into 4 individual serving cups.
Fill the cups with milk and mix well before serving.
serve chilled.

recipeDescription: Almond fingure is a sweet dish recipe with roasted and chopped almonds(badam) mixed with crushed digestive biscuits, milk chocolate, honey and butter. These delicious and tempting almond fingurine are simply irrestible!
preparationMethod: Grease and line an squarecake tin.
Put the butter,chocolate and honey in a pan and heat gently until melted.
Stir in the biscuits crumbs and almond until thoroughly mixed,turn into the prepared tin and smooth the top.
Leave until set,then cut into fingers before serving.

recipeDescription: Amazon is a cool cucumber juice with the cucumbers blended with fresh lime juice and salt. Add a pinch of roasted cumin seed powder and you have the refreshingly delicious and tempting amazing drink .
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingrediennts and blend them.
Put some crushed ice in a glass , por over and blend .
Garnish with cucumber juliennes and cucumber sticks with skin ( as long as possible ).

recipeDescription: The one other benefit is that you can make anjeer puranpoli using this barfi. Just use this mixture like regular stuffing.
preparationMethod: Cut dried figs in small pieces and add some water and microwave on high for 2 minute.
Make a puree using a little water if required.
Chop seedless dates in a microwave oven and microwave on high for one minute and make a puree using a little water if required.
First roast almonds, cashewnuts and pistachios and than chop all the nuts in small pieces.
Grease a tray.
Heat ghee in a pan.
Add anjeer puree and dates puree and saute well and cook on medium heat, stirring continuously, for 5 minutes or till mixture leaves the side of pan.
Add almonds, cashewnuts and pistachios.
Mix well for two minutes, stirring continuously.
Spread evenly on the greased tray.
Cover with dry fruit powder.
When cool, cut into pieces and serve.

recipeDescription: A spicy eggplant or brinjal(baigan) bhurta recipe with roasted brinjals mashed and cooked with onion, tomato and ginger-garlic paste. The baigan bharta recipe is just rightly spiced to suit all palates. A simple yet unique variation to a typical brinjal preparation.
preparationMethod: Wash brinjal, make slits, apply oil and cook on a direct flame, turning the brinjal , till the skin turns dark and wrinkled.
Peel and mash the brinjals properly.
Heat the oil in a kadai, add the green chillies, garlic and onions and saute till they turn brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes and saute until it turns soft.
Add the masala powders and turmeric and salt, mix well and cook till the oil leaves the sides.
Add mashed brinjal and coriander leaves along with 1/2 cup water, mix well and cook till the gravy becomes thick.
Just before serving heat ghee and add to the burta, mix well
Serve hot with phulkas.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: Basically it's an open sandwich made with pizza toppings. Simple yet scrumptious. A mixture of chopped veggies and spices is spread on bread slices and sprinkled with yummy mozzarella cheese and baked in the oven.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients except bread, cheese and ketchup in a bowl and mix well.
Arrange bread slices on a greased baking tray and apply littl ketchup on each slice followed by cheese.
Top it with the prepared mixture.
Then sprinkle more cheese.
Bake in a preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes until cheese melts and bread is nice and crusty.

recipeDescription: Can serve it with pita or taco chips
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).
In a large mixing bowl, combine cheddar cheese, mayonnaise, half of the olives, jalapeno peppers, garlic and hot pepper sauce. spread the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan.
Bake for 20 minutes, or until heated through. sprinkle over the dish the remaining olives, chopped tomatoes and green onions.

recipeDescription: Baked penne in tomato sauce is a tangy and cheesy preparation. While boiling pastas, add a few drops of oil in the boiling water, so that the pastas will not stick to each other.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions and garlic and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the tomato puree and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the coriander-cumin powder, chilli powder, oregano, salt and mix well and futher simmer for 5 minutes. Keep aside.

Finally spread the cheese evenly covering all the sides and top with capsicum rings.
Bake in a pre-heated oven and bake till the cheese melts.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Baked rajmah delight presents a protein and calcium rich baked beans recipe with the cooked rajmah beans topped with chopped capsicum and grated cheese and then baked till the cheese melts. Enjoy with toasted french bread.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the ginger garlic paste and saute for 1 minute/
Add the onions and saute till they turn golden brown in colour.
Add the tomatoes and saute till the oil separates.
Add the tomato ketchup , salt and pepper and saute on a medium flame for a minute.
Add the soaked rajmah and saute for 2 minutes.
Pressure cook for 3 to 4 whistles, or till the rajma are cooked.
Transfer in a greased baking dish and sprinkle the chopped capsicum and grated cheese evenly on top.
Bake in a pre-heated oven till the cheese melts.
Serve hot with toasted french bread.

recipeDescription: Baked tofu nuggets, tofu marinated in soy sauce and bake till brown. It is best to serve as a starter for the parties.
preparationMethod: Cut the tofu into 1/4" to 1/2" slices and press between layers of paper towel for about 1 to 2 hours. Keep aside.
Combine the soy sauce and pepper powder, mix well and add the tofu, mix well and keep aside to marinate for 2-4 hours.
Before baking, add sesame seeds and toss well.
Bake at 350 degree celsius, until the tofu is lightly browned and has a crisp texture.
Serve immediately with tomato sauce.

ingredients: cloves of garlic (lehsun), peeled and sliced
recipeDescription: Basic curry sauce is an Indian sauce recipe with onions, tomatoes and ginger garlic paste cooked together. The traditional brown sauce curry can be used as a base for fish, chicken or paneer dishes.
preparationMethod: Method
Heat the oil in a heavy pan then add the chopped onion and stir for a few minutes with the heat on high.
Add the ginger, garlic and green chilli (if using). stir for 30 seconds then put the heat down to very low.
Cook for 15 minutes stirring from time to time making sure nothing browns or burns.
Add the turmeric, cumin and coriander and cook, still very gently, for a further 5 minutes. don't burn the spices or the sauce will taste horrid - sprinkle on a few drops of water if you're worried.
Take off the heat and cool a little. put 4 fl oz cold water in a blender, add the contents of the pan and whizz until very smooth. add the passata and stir.

Put the puréed mixture back into the pan and cook for 20 - 30 minutes (the longer the better) over very low heat stirring occasionally. you can add a little hot water if it starts to catch on the pan but the idea is to gently "fry" the sauce which will darken in colour to an orangy brown. the final texture should be something like good tomato ketch

recipeDescription: A tasty and healthy sandwich which will tempt your your tastebuds to have more than one...
preparationMethod: Blend the pulses in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer in a bowl and add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
Divide the mixture into 8 equal portions and shape them into small round flat tikkis.
Heat the oil in a tava and shallow fry the tikkis till they turn golden brown and crisp from both the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
Toast the bread slices with butter till golden brown on a nonstick pan.

recipeDescription: 1.tastes great after chilling in refrigerator for some time. 2. beetroot contains lots of iron and healthy vitamins.

Add the masala powders and turmeric and salt, mix well and cook till the oil leaves the sides.
Add mashed brinjal and coriander leaves along with 1/2 cup water, mix well and cook till the gravy becomes thick.
Just before serving heat ghee and add to the burta, mix well

recipeDescription: Besan omlette or besan chilla recipe with gram flour mixed together with onion, tomatoes, chillies and spices before spreading on a non-stick pan like pancake. A vegetarian omelette recipe, besan omelette taste superb with a green chutney or sauce of choice.

Add water and make thin batter.
Adjust salt.

recipeDescription: A tasty tiffin as well as breakfast recipe. Really easy and fast to make. Consumes very less amount of time and yes kids will love it.

In a flat non stick pan heat the oil.

Keep aside.

recipeDescription: Besan pancakes or as commonly known as tomato omelette is a vegetarian gram flour based pancake or omelette recipe. The gram flour batter is mixed with chopped onion, tomatoes and chillies and then spread on a pan . Relish the hot and crispy besan pancakes with ketchup or green chutney.

Add enough water to make a thin-medium consistency batter.
Mix well to avoid any lumps

Pour some oil around and on the pancakes.
After a minute toss the pancake the other side.
Both the sides of the pancake should be golden brown. then take the pancake out.

Apply this batter on both sides of the bread.

recipeDescription: Bread pizza ready to eat without oven.

Put 2 bread slices on it
Heat on slow flame

recipeDescription: If there is no tomato puree u can add tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: Quick and a simple snack made in microwave Kids are sure to love this!
preparationMethod: Spread the butter evenly on one side of the bread slices. Place them on a grill and grill till they turn crisp and golden brown.
Apply a little more butter and ketchup on the other side and spread equal amounts of vegetables, cheese, oregano and basil and sprinkle little salt.

recipeDescription: bread poha recipe | veg bread poha | easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions | with amazing 16 images. bread poha recipe is has been adapted from the famous Maharashtrian poha recipe. Who does not love Poha! An everyday food, Poha is loved all over the country and often enjoyed as a breakfast of snack. Here, the regular Poha recipe has been adapted for bread cubes. A traditional tempering and veggies like onions, tomatoes and capsicum transform the bread cubes into a sumptuous Veg Bread Poha, which is enhanced further by the addition of peppy garam masala. Kids generally make a fuss for eating Indian snacks but make this bread poha and it’s a perfect after school snack. I am sure your kid would gulp it down in minutes. The procedure is very simple and quick for Bread Poha recipe, How to make Bread Poha, Easy bread poha. Heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds. When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds. Add the onions and green chillies, green chillies can be adjusted to your preference of spice. Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Add the turmeric powder and tomatoes and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes. Add the bread pieces, salt and peppy garam masala, mix well and cook while stirring occasionally. Serve hot garnished with coriander which would add freshness to bread poha. Indeed, this satiating snack of easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions is something that both kids and adults will love, and it is also convenient and easy to make, with simple everyday ingredients found in the Indian kitchen. So, when you come home hungry and find nothing but bread and veggies in your fridge, you know what to make. Enjoy bread poha recipe | veg bread poha | easy bread poha with tomatoes, onions | with detailed step by step recipe photos and video.
preparationMethod: To make bread poha, heat the oil in a broad non-stick pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for a few seconds.
Add the onions and green chillies and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the capsicum and sauté on a medium flame for 2 minutes.

Add the bread pieces, salt and garam masala, mix well and cook on a medium flame for 2 minutes, while stirring occasionally.

Serve the bread poha hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Go ahead and prepare the innovative egg preparation, Bread-omelette curry and enjoy this egg dipped bread slices simmered in spicy gravy with paranthas or Rotis. A nice variation to the traditional boiled egg curry recipe, bread omelette curry is easy to prepare and delicious..
preparationMethod: Beat eggs with enough salt and chilli powder.
Add quarter spoon of the enitre ginger garlic paste and garam masala powder to the egg mixture.beat thoroughly.
Dip entire slice of bread and make bombay or french toast ready for the main curry.

recipeDescription: Enjoy this low cal soup with goodness of fibre from broccoli. You can enjoy this soup warm/cold depending on your preference.
preparationMethod: Heat up oil in a pan and sauté onion and garlic for a minute.
Add celery and salt and stir well.
Add 2 cups of water and cover the pan and allow to cook for 4-5 mins.
After 5 minutes, add the broccoli and cook for 5 minutes.
Remove from the flame and cool it a bit and blend it to thin consistency in a blender.
Pass it through a sieve if want and allow it to boil for 3-4 mins.
Add pepper and garnish with broccoli florets.
Adjust the taste of pepper and consistency as per your wish.

recipeDescription: Broccoli and Mushroom Quesadillas is a kid friendly snack recipe with cheese, broccoli and mushrooms spooned into the tortilla cups and baked till done. Enjoy the healthy Mexican snack delight, quesadillas with sauce or plain.
preparationMethod: Saute the onion; mushrooms, garlic and herbs in the butter over medium heat until lightly browned, about 10 min. add salt and pepper and little red chilli powder(optional)
Spoon this mixture over 4 tortillas that have been placed on lightly greased cookie sheets.
Top each tortilla with broccoli and cheese and a second tortilla.
Bake in a 180 c oven until cheese melts, about 10 min. cut each quesadilla into wedges to serve.

recipeDescription: A superb in taste baked dish recipe, the Broccoli Au Gratin has the crunchy fresh broccoli florets enrobed in white sauce and cheese and baked till perfection.
preparationMethod: Wash & cut broccoli in small flowrests. blanch in boiling water.
Make white sauce with flour, butter & milk.
Add seasonnings & 3/4 of greated cheese.
Toss broccoli in butter.
Arreng broccoli in greased pie dish, pour sauce over it. sprinkle with remaining cheese
Gratinate under salamander or put in oven in water bath for 2-3 mins. at 150 c.

recipeDescription: Broccoli bhanavle is an inspired vegetable preparation with broccoli florets cooked with other vegetables in a besan and coconut milk based gravy. Enjoy baked broccoli bhanavale as a main dish.
preparationMethod: Chop broccoli, onion, coriander & chilly.
Add besan & all the ingredients.
Mix the coconut milk.
Add water to make a paste.
Grease a baking tin.
Pour the mixture in the tin
Bake in the oven for 1/2 hour at 200 c
You can add prawns for non-veg.

recipeDescription: Incorporate the goodness of broccoli along with red onions, and herbs in the Broccoli delight recipe. The broccoli delight makes for an excellent side dish or salad recipe.
preparationMethod: Start by chopping up broccoli heads into small bite size pieces and set aside in a large mixing bowl.
Then finely chop up red onion and add to bowl.
Add the raisins and sunflower seeds.
Next add the poppyseed dressing slowly and mix well.
Note you may not need to use the entire jar of dressing.
Pepper to taste.
Let the mixture marinate in the refidgerator for 2 hours and then serve.

ingredients: a pinch of roasted cumin seeds (jeera) powder black salt (sanchal)
recipeDescription: Do not mix salt and keep it, mix the salt at time when you are ready to serve. this will keep the salad tasty and it wont loose water and taste
preparationMethod: Cut cabbage and tomatoes in to small pieces
Peel the pomogenerate add chillies cut in to small add jeera pdr. and black salt mix well
Garnish with corriander leaves.

recipeDescription: Cabbage and onion pakoda is a simple fried pakoda or snack recipe with the mixture consisting of chopped cabbage and onions dipped in a batter and then deep fried. Enjoy this crispy delight with green chutney or sauce of choice.
preparationMethod: Cut the cabbage into small pieces.
Cut the onion into lengthwise and green chilli into small pieces.
Mix all the ingradients with little water and make a thick dough.
Heat oil in a pan, make pakodas with that dough and deep fry them.
Serve hot with tomato sauce.

recipeDescription: Tasty pakodas made in a jiffy with few easily available ingridients.
preparationMethod: Combine the cabbage, onion and green chillies in a bowl, add salt and rub it nicely so that cabbage and onions water is released.
Add the besan slowly mixing it nicely
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the pakodas in hot oil till golden brown.
Serve hot with green chutney or phudina chutney.

recipeDescription: A crunchy and healthful cabbage and paneer salad has finely chopped cabbage and diced paneer tossed together in a a lovely dressing.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan and add the mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the curry leaves, cabbage, capsicum, paneer, green chillies and saute for 2 minutes.
Remove from the flame, add the salt and lemon juice.
Serve warm.

recipeDescription: Here is a traditional thick soup recipe, the Cabbage Chowder with a delectable hint of chopped celery , cabbage and select seasonings.
preparationMethod: Wash and chop vegetables. all the seeds must be removed from the green pepper and it should be rinsed well before chopping.
Put vegetables in a pan with water, salt and pepper.
Bring to boil and simmer for about 15 min.
Prepare a white sauce with butter and flour and milk.
Add to the veg. mixture.
Add cheese and paprika and stir still cheese has melted.

recipeDescription: A simple, tasty and healthy Cabbage Sandwich with chopped cabbage along with select dressings and seasonings as filling in between the bread slices.
preparationMethod: Mix the two sauces together and keep aside.
Put the sandwich maker on to heat.
Apply the mixed sauce on two slices of bread.
Now spread a little of the the shredded cabbage on one the slices applied with the sauce.
Sprinkle a little cheese on the cabbage and cover with the other slice with sauce.
Now put the prepared bread slices in the sandwich maker and leave till it is done.
Cut it into half and serve hot with tomato and cucumber slices.

recipeDescription: 1. do not over cook the cabbage filling. 2. if required spicy apply green chutney on both the slices. 3. onions are optional and can be added before adding the capsicum.
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a pan.
Add capsicum, chilli paste and ginger paste.
Add the cabbage and stir for 3- 4 mins. do not over cook.
Add salt to taste
Add the coriander leaves
Butter two slices of bread and add green chutney on one of the bread.
Put the cabbage filling on the other buttered bread and cover with the chutney slice.
Place the sandwiched bread in a sandwich toaster and let it cook for 5 mins.
Serve hot with green chutney and ketchup.

recipeDescription: A tasty toast sandwich filled with a mix od cabbage,tomatoes, garlic and chillies.
preparationMethod: Chop cabbage very fine,mix some salt &keep aside for 20 minutes.
Apply butter &chuteny on all 2 slices.
Squeeze out water from cabbage.
Add chilly,garlic & tomatto.mix well.
Spread cabbage on one slice of bread cover with other & make toast in equity toaster.
Serve hot with tomatto ketch up & green chutney.

recipeDescription: Try with parathas and we can use it as a dry curry
preparationMethod: Wash capsicum and cut them into pices of small size.
Cut onions and tomatoes also into pices of the same size as of capsicum
Heat the oil in a pan
Add onion and tomato pieces first. let it fry till it becomes soft.
Now add capsicum and add haldi,mirchi powder,salt and cover with a lid till capsicum becomes soft.
Keep stirring in between
Now add garam masala powder, and dry coconut and serve.
The whole cooking has to be done on a low flame.

recipeDescription: Mushrooms and capsicum is a novel combination and accompanied with specific masalas work wonders to our taste buds. Mushroom and capsicum fry is a tasty and colourful dish which can be served with roti or parathas.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a pan, add the onions, green chillies and ginger and saute on a medium flame for 2 minutes.
Add the capiscum, mushroom, chilli powder and salt and saute for 2 to 4 minutes.
Add the tomato sauce and sprinkle little water and simmer for 2 minutes on a medium flame.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: An unusual chutney with mild flavors. It goes well with dosa and idli.
preparationMethod: Heat 3 tsp oil in a pan, add the ginger, garlic and cashewnuts and saute till they turn golden brown.
Add the coconut and saute for 2 minutes.
ADd the tomatoes, mix well and saute for 1 minute.
Add the salt, turmeric and chilli powder and mix well.
Cover and cook the tomatoes with about half cup of water.
Once the tomatoes are cooked, cool it and then grind the chutney coarsely.
Heat the remaining oil in a small pan and add the mustard and cumin seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the asafoetida and immediately pour the tempering on the chutney.
Serve with idli or dosa.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: A soup with unique flavours of strong cauliflower and mild walnuts.
preparationMethod: Combine the cauliflower, onions and stock in a deep pa, mix well and bring to the boil.
Cover and simmer for 15 minutes or till they turn soft.
Add the milk and walnuts, mix well and cook for 10 minutes.
Cool and blend in a mixer till smooth.
Transfer the soup to the same pan, add the salt and pepper, mix well and bring to boil
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Tread the nostalgic lanes with this easy and quick cauliflower recipe, cauliflower (gobhi) in curry. The curry is prepared with onion-tomato and ginger garlic paste along with Indian spice powders. The cauliflower in curry recipe sans rich masala and overpowering spices. A healthy and tasty vegetarian treat for the entire family.
preparationMethod: Soak cashew nuts in half cup milk for half an hour and the make a fine paste adding the rest half cup of milk.
Puree tomato well by grinding it in a mixer and set aside.
Cut cauliflower in 2 inch big florets. add little salt, turmeric and garam masala powder and set aside for 10 min.

Heat a non-stick pan and add oil. add jeera and allow it to crackle. add the cauliflower florets and let it shallow fry in the oil until light brown. add the rest of the garam masala poeder red chilly powder and turmeric powder.
Add tomato puree. bring the subzi to a boil. add cashew nut paste and let it boil for 1-2 min. add salt to taste.
Switch off the gas and garnish with corriander leaves.

recipeDescription: After making cauliflower curry, i had a small portion left over. So i thought of making some snack item with the remaining cauliflower for a evening munch. I used to prepare onion pakoda before. So i thought of making something similar with cauliflower too.
preparationMethod: Boil the cauliflower in salted water for 7 minutes in a microwave oven.
Drain and add all the ingredients and mix well to make a thick smooth batter.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and drop small balls of mixture and deep fry till they turn golden brown and crisp from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot.

recipeDescription: It is kind of a simple home-curry. Just the combination of ingredients is quite new!
preparationMethod: Wash and remove stems from cauliflower.
Take out the florets and chop them into small dice-sized pieces.
Clean spinach leaves and chop them nicely.
Heat oil in a big kadhai and add cumin seeds.
Once it crackles, add hing and chopped cauliflower along with some water, salt and turmeric powder.
Let it cook covered for 7-8 mins and then add chopped spinach along with all the spices.
Mix everything well and cook it uncovered for 10 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Instead of besan you can use egg.
preparationMethod: Mix chopped spinach, chopped onion and grated coconut together.
Add salt green shilli paste to it.
Add besan and water mix all.
Pour the mixed mixture on tava and place the chapathi on top of it and press.
Then reverse the chapathi, and roll them.
Apply butter on top of it and serve

recipeDescription: Dont throw the left over chapities as another receipe for the morning breakfast can be prepared within no time try it
preparationMethod: Crumble the left over chapaties with hand and keep aside
Heat oil in a pan and add to it a little musterd seeds, cumin seeds,finily cut onions tomato and chillis fry till golden brown
After that add the crumbled chapaties and stir well till it is soft
Garnish with coconut and corinder leaves

recipeDescription: Chappati upma is an innovative upma recipe with left over chapattis soaked and then cooked with onion, mustard seeds, curry leaves, lime juice and chopped coriander leaves. An excellent breakfast item, chapatti upma is easy and delicious.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a kadhai and add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle, add the garlic, green chillis and tomato and saute for 2 minutes.
Add the masalas and tamarind, mix well and saute for 2-3 minutes.
Add 2 cups of water, mix well and bring it to boil.
Add the chapatis and simmer for 5 mins.
Serve hot garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: A preparation of leftover chappatis cut into noodle like strips tossed with nutritious veggies.
preparationMethod: Cut the left over chapattis into thin strips (like noodles). keep aside.
Heat the oil in the pan, add mustard seed and allow it to splutter.
Add the onion, ginger and green chilli, curry leaves and sauté on a medium flame for 10 minutes or till the onion are cooked.
Add tomatoes and sauté till the oil separates out.
Add chilly powder, coriander powder and gram masala powder and sauté for few minutes
Add the finely cut chapattis into it and sauté for another few minutes
If required add some tomato sauce and again sauté it atleast for 10 minutes or until it blends and chapattis become crisp.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Bhujia chaat is a special chaat recipe with bhujias and sev tossed with sweet and spicy chutneys.
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and mix well.
Serve immediately garnished with coriander.

recipeDescription: Do not crush idli's. cut them with a knife. it would be easier for frying.
preparationMethod: Cut idli''s to small pieces
Pour oil in a pan
Deep fry idli''s till they turn brown.
Place fried idli''s in a tissue paper. this would absorb excess oil.
Place another pan and add a spoon of oil.
Add curry leaves and allow it to spatter.
Remove curry leaves from the pan
Add ketchup and 5 spoons of water.
Add fried idli''s in the pan.
Transfer them to a plate and decorate with the curry leaves.
Serve hot

recipeDescription: Slice the cucumber very thin for best results.
preparationMethod: Slightly toast the bread slices on a tava with butter till light brown.
Spread the cheese on both the slices evenly.
Sprinkle the pepper on the bread.
Spread 5 slices of the cucumber on one slice.
Sprinkle pepper on the cucumber.
Do the same for the other slice of bread.
Sandwich them and serve.

recipeDescription: This is an amazing easy and equally quick prepared dish for everyone at any time .this can be served for guest and for children and everybody.
preparationMethod: Cut the bread slices into 4 pieces and aside.
Heat oil in a non-stick pan, add the cumin seeds and mustard seeds.
When the seeds crackle add the onions, tomatoes and capsicum.
Cook for a few minutes, add the chilli powder,turmeric powder and salt.
Add the bread pieces and grated cheese, mix well.
Sere immediately.

recipeDescription: This dish can be served as a delicious evening snack and its eye catching looks make it more suitable for serving to guests.
preparationMethod: Take bread slice and cut it in round shape using a bread cutter.
Spread 1 tbsp butter on the bread slices followed by 1 tbsp tomato ketchup over it.
Sprinkle the tomato and capsicum evenly.
Cover with cheese and sprinkle some pepper and salt.
Similarly prepare more 5 open sandwiches using remaining bread slices and ingredients.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 180 degree Celsius for 3-4 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Easy and yummy bread toasted and covered with lots of cheese. A tasty snack.
preparationMethod: Mix all the veg.and cheese together along with salt
Toast the bread on one side
Spread butter on other side
Now spread the cheese mix over the butter side of bread
Grill it till cheese melts and browns.
Serve hot with tomato sauceh

recipeDescription: A popular cheesy bread based snack and kid's favorite cheese toast is an easy and quick recipe to prepare cheese toasts. The delicious cheese toasts melt in the mouth and are loved by all.
preparationMethod: Toast the bread on one side
Put grate cheese on the other slice of toast
Put the onion and tomatoe on the top of the cheese
Serve with tomatoe ketchup or tabasco.
Than cook it for few minutes
This is your cheese toast

recipeDescription: A healthy breakfast recipe of toasted bread with toppings if onion and mushroom covered with a layer of cheese.
preparationMethod: Toast the bread slices (optional).
Heat the oil. lightly fry the vegetables and mushrooms.
Add salt. spread the vegetable mix over the bread slice and top it with grated cheese.
Melt cheese in the oven and serve the mushroom toasts.

recipeDescription: A cheesy snack prepared in advance for Diwali. It is handy as can be cooked and kept in airtight container anywhere in the house.
preparationMethod: Mix all the dry ingredients first for dough.
Bring it to bread crumb consistency.
Now add wet ingredients and knead a dough.
Cover the dough with muslin cloth and keep it aside for 30 mins
Now heat oil in a wok for frying.
Roll the dough and cut desired shapes.
Leave the namakpars in oil and fry on medium flame till it is cooked well and crisp.
Cool it down and store in a airtight container

recipeDescription: Be careful with the salt quantity as cheese too contains salt.
preparationMethod: Heat the oil in a wok or karahi.
Saute onion on a high heat for 2 min.
Add capsicum and saute for 2 min.
Add tomato and saute for few more mins
Add tomato ketchup and season as per taste.
Take off from heat.
Now lightly heat the tortillas or chapatis from both sides,brush with butter.
Fill each tortilla with the above mixture spread grated cheese over it.
Wrap and seal with toothpick.
And grill till cheese is melted and tortilla is crisp or heat on tava from both the sides.
Now cut in to the pieces and serve hot with tea or fresh juice.

recipeDescription: It can be made crispy by spreading Marie biscuit crumbs on it (before spreading cheese)
preparationMethod: Make a slightly thick batter of maida,sooji and besan and add salt and red chilli powder to it.
Keep aside the batter for 8 - 10 minutes.
Heat the tawa.apply little oil on it.
Dip 1 slice of bread in the batter and put it on the tawa.
On the top ,uncooked side of the bread, spread chopped onion tomato and corriander.
Spread kali mirch.
Keep applying oil on the bread.press on top a little.
Now turn it upside down and let the other side cook and turn brown.
When both the sides are done,bring it down from the tawa and spread cheese on top.
Serve with tomato and chilli sauce.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: An innovative recipe where famous and all time favourite chilli paneer is stuffed between buns to give it a twist..
preparationMethod: Heat oil in a kadhai and deep fry paneer pieces till they turn golden brown from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and keep aside.
Heat 4 tbsp of oil in a pan, add green chillies, dry red chillies ,garlic and ginger and saute for a minute.
Add the onions and saute till golden brown.
Add capsicum and saute for few minutes, making sure they don't turn very soft.
Add all the sauces and mix well.
Add the fried paneer and boiled pasta and cook on low fflame for 2 minutes.
Keep aside.
Cut the buns into 2 pieces.
Heat a tava and sprinkle some chilli powder on it and then just brush the bun for 30 seconds.
Do same for all the buns.
Put the cooked paneer mixture in the middle of two buns.
Serve hot.

recipeDescription: Cook up breakfasts within minutes with this popular and simple chilli- cheese toast recipe.Simply apply cheese and chilli sauce over the bread slices and bake it to crispy finish in a preheated oven.
preparationMethod: Preheat oven to 400 f.cut capsium without seeds to small pieces ., mix all the above ingredients ., spread on the bread slices and bake for 10 -15 mts., remove cut into triangles and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

recipeDescription: A delicious Chinese starter..
preparationMethod: Combine the flour and butter and mix well using your palms, till the mixture resembles bread crumbs.
Add the cheese, mix well and knead into a soft dough using chilled water.
Roll our the dough, using little plain flour, into a 1/4" thick rectangular shape.
Keep aside.
Combine the cauliflower, coriander, onion, chillies and white sauce in a bowl and mix well.
Add salt, mix well and spread this mixture evenly on the dough.
Roll the dough from one side and seal from the end.
Wrap in butter paper and keep in the refrigerator for half an hour.
Cut into round slices of 1/2" thickness. and place them on a flat greased baking tray.
Bake in a pre-heated oven at 375°C for 20 minutes or till it turns golden browna nd crisp.
Cool and serve.

recipeName: Chinese Style Bread Noodles in Soya and Tomato Sauce
recipeDescription: This comforting and reliable classic features bread,vegetables cooked in Soya and Tomato Sauce. It's just delicious!
preparationMethod: Dip the bread slices in water squeeze and mash them well.
Pass them through chakli press and press out small balls of the mixture into idli moulds.
Steam using steamer for 5 to 7 minutes.
Allow them to cool.
Heat the oil in a pan or a kadhai and add the green chilli paste and saute for 30 seconds.
Add the mixed vegetables and m.s.g and saute ona high flame for few minutes.
Add salt , mix well and add the bread noodles to the vegetables and saute for a few minutes
Add the soya sauce and tomato ketchup and mix well.
Remove from the flame and serve hot.

recipeDescription: Prepare your own Chocolate with a combination of bitter and sweet chocolates and mix it with crushed nuts. Wrap the customized chocolates in attractive wrappers and gift them to your loved ones.
preparationMethod: Take dark chocolate and sweet chocolate in 1:2 proportion and cut them into small pieces
Melt the chocolate under double boiler system, i.e., place the vessel with the chocolate over the vessel with boiling water. keep stirring till the chocolate melts completely.
Add the nuts and raisins to the melted chocolate. blend well. fill the melted chocolate in moulds. tap the filled moulds well to remove air bubbles.
Place the moulds in the refrigerator for about two hours to let the chocolate set.
Remove the moulds from the refrigerator and tap them to remove the chocolates. wrap the chocolates in attractive wrappers and place in a basket or dish according to your choice.

recipeDescription: Chocolate biscuit cake, easy and tasty chocolate flavoured biscuit cake is one of the favorite cake recipes loved by childrens and all.
preparationMethod: Grease a medium round cake tin and cover with butter papper keep aside.
Melt the plain chocolate with the milk in a pan, then stir in the butter.
Remove from the flame and allow to cool but do not allow to solidifies. Keep aside.
Break the biscuits into small pieces and mix it with the melted chocolate, chocolate nutties and dry fruits.
Stir the mixture and pour into the greased cake tin.
Refrigerate it for a minimum of 3 hours until it is set firmly.
Remove the cake from the tin and peel away the butter paper.
Slice it into thin wedges and serve it cold.

recipeDescription: We have tried a lots of savory flavours of dosas, but here is dosa that can be served as a sweet dish loaded with lots of Vitamins and Yuminess. Chocolate truffle sauce gives it an entirely different taste and will be loved by kids, as no kid can say no to chocolate.
preparationMethod: Heat the cream/milk in a non-stick pan.Switch off the gas.
Add the chocolate and mix well till thick. Keep aside to cool.
Heat a non-stick tava (griddle), sprinkle a little water and wipe it off gently using a cloth.
Pour a half a cup of the batter on it and spread it in a circular motion to make a thick circle, so that when we load it with fruits it doesn't break.
Smear little unsalted butter over it and along the edges and cook on medium flame to make a soft light brown dosa.

Take it on a plate and let it cool for 2 minutes. Spread some chocolate truffle sauce evenly all over the dosa, place some fruits on one end of the dosa , top it up with a few cashewnuts and raisins and roll it up.
Drizzle some chocolate truffle Sauce in a zig zag pattern on the stuffed dosa.
Cut it into pieces and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: An easy dip recipe with the combination of sun-dried tomatoes and pickled cucumbers.
preparationMethod: In a mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients together. Mix well.
Place it in a serving bowl and serve immediately or chilled with assorted chips,fries and nuggets.

recipeDescription: Chutney sandwich with vegetables stuffed is an healthy sandwich recipe which is sure to be loved by children and is also a great way to add veggies in a child's diet. The chutney is spread on the bread which are filled with veggies, cheese and then toasted with butter.
preparationMethod: Take 2 slices of bread
Cut in to 2 small square shapes
Take one tomato, and 1 cucumber.
Chop them finally into small pieces.
Add 1 spoon of butter on the top of the bread
Add 2 spoons of chutney on the top of both the slices of the bread.
Put cucumber and tomato pieces on the top of both the slices
Put the 2nd slice on the top of the cucumber and tomato
Add 1 pinch of salt and black peper on the bread
And serveo

recipeDescription: Cocktail chila (tomato and onion omelette) is a healthy and protein rich chila or pancake recipe with gram flour mixed with chopped onions, tomatoes and spice powder,. Cut into small pieces and enjoyed crispy hot with sauce or chutney of choice with your cocktails.
preparationMethod: Comine all ingredients in a bowl, mix well and add 2 cups of water gradually to make a smooth batter of flowing consistency.
Heat a non stick pan and pour a spoonful of batter and spread evenly to make small round pancakes.
Flip over when one side is cooked, using a little oil.
Serve ot hwith mint chutney and tomato sauce.

ingredients: salt freshly ground black pepper powder
recipeDescription: A delicious crunchy snack... blend of crunchy vegetable and cheese!!
preparationMethod: Combine all the ingredients, except the maida paste, samosa patti and oil, in a bowl and mix well.
Divide the mixture into small round balls and keep aside.
Dip a ball in the maida paste and cover the ball with samosa strip so that it sticks well.
Sprinkle some plain flour and keep aside.
Similarly prepare other balls.
Heat the oil in a kadhai and deep fry the balls till they turn golden brown from all the sides.
Drain on an absorbent paper and serve hot with cocktail!

recipeDescription: Quick and lip smacking smoothie!
preparationMethod: Combine all ingredients and blend in a mixer till smooth and creamy.
Pour in to serving glasses.
Garnish with chocolate sauce.
Serve chilled.

recipeDescription: A crispy crunchy healthy and tasteful Colourful smiles are a perfect choice for parties and festivals. The circular shaped bread slices are applied with tomato paste, topped with vegetables and sprinkled with grated cheese.
preparationMethod: Take 4 slices of bread and cut them into circles.
Fry the bread on a low flame till they are light brown.
